      • main

      • listRobots

        public static java.util.Queue<Robot> listRobots(boolean currentVersionOnly,
                                                java.lang.String name,
                                                java.lang.String team,
                                                java.lang.Integer minWins,
                                                java.lang.Integer maxWins,
                                                java.lang.Integer minLosses,
                                                java.lang.Integer maxLosses,
                                                java.lang.Integer minMatches,
                                                java.lang.Integer maxMatches)
        lists all robots that meet the passed in parameters. All parameters are optional except currentVersionOnly
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the robot we are searching for. Can be a regular expression
        team - the name of the team of the robots we are looking for
        minWins - the minimum number of wins of the robots we should return
        maxWins - the maximum number of wins of the robots we should return
        minLosses - the minimum number of losses of the robots we should return
        maxLosses - the maximum number of losses of the robots we should return
        minMatches - the minimum number of matches of the robots we should return
        maxMatches - the maximum number of matches of the robots we should return
        currentVersionOnly - determines whether we should show all version of robots, or just the latest
        Returns:
        a list of robots that match the above parameters

      • getRobot

        public static Robot getRobot(long serial)
        returns a specific robot
        Parameters:
        serial - the serial number of the robot to search for
        Returns:
        the robot object

      • registerRobot

        public static boolean registerRobot(java.lang.String name,
                                    java.lang.String team,
                                    long firepower,
                                    long health,
                                    long movement,
                                    java.lang.String forthCode)
                             throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        registers a robot. Returns whether the registration was a success
        Parameters:
        name - the new robot's name
        team - the new robot's team
        firepower - the new robot's firepower
        health - the new robot's health
        movement - the max number of moves the new robot can make in a turn
        forthCode - a text string representing the robot's forth code
        Returns:
        a bool indicating whether the registration was a success
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException

      • reviseRobot

        public static boolean reviseRobot(long serialNumber,
                                  long newFirepower,
                                  long newHealth,
                                  long newMovement,
                                  java.lang.String newForthCode)
        allows us to make changes to the attributes of a particular robot
        Parameters:
        serialNumber - the serial number of the robot we want to change
        newFirepower - the new firepower value
        newHealth - the new health value
        newMovement - the new number of moves per turn
        newForthCode - the new forth code
        Returns:
        boolean indicating whether the revision was a success

      • retireRobot

        public static void retireRobot(long serialNumber)
                        throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        retires a robot
        Parameters:
        serialNumber - the serial number of the robot we want to retire
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException

      • updateStats

        public static boolean updateStats(long serialNumber,
                                  RobotGameStats currentStats)
        updates a robot's stats on the server
        Parameters:
        serialNumber - the serial number of the robot to update
        currentStats - the stats we want to update
        Returns:
        boolean if stats were updated
